treatment.description: Bulbs 1.5–2.5 × 1.6–2.8 cm. Leaf blade 1–3 mm wide. Tepals white or pale pink with deep pink midveins, aging to pink. Pedicel 10–17 mm. 2n = 28.
treatment.habitat: rocky margins entire, apex obtuse or acute, slopes and plains
treatment.discussion: Allium perdulce var. sperryi is a well-marked, poly-ploid, geographic variant. Although both varieties of the species reach the same extremes of size, var. sperryi is, on average, considerably taller and stouter than var. perdulce. It also tends to have a larger number of flowers and longer pedicels. Distributions of the two varie-ties do not overlap.
